#summary This is the Example 1 using the Search Tab

= Identify all human proteins using the Search Tab =

The first step is to find the Human Taxonomy Object.

Click on the New Search menu item on the Tabs menu. After that, type *human* on the quick search text field and then click on the *Search* button.
 
http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/Ex1_1.jpg
 
Now, a [ListTab List Tab] will be created with the search result. Then, check the Homo Sapiens check box and select on the right click popup the *Save Selected* option. 
 
http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/Ex1_2.jpg
 
http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/Ex1_3.jpg
 
On the *Result Tab* select on the right click popup the *Add to New Search* option. This click will create a new [SearchTab Search Tab] with the Homo Sapiens taxonomy as a constrain.
 
http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/Ex1_4.jpg
 
On the new [SearchTab Search Tab] select the Protein on the !ComboBox and view in the Constrain Table the Taxonomy constrain added.

http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/Ex1_5.jpg

Finally, click on the *Search* button and wait until the creation of the new [ListTab List Tab] with all human proteins.

http://jbiowh.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/Ex1_6.jpg

Note that the system found 20282 human proteins. This example was executed just over the Uniprot SWISSPROT branch.
